William (Coakee) Wildcat

· 1st

Executive Director, Mother Tree Food & Forest

Silver City, New Mexico, United States

·

Contact info

Mother Tree Food & Forest

Environment Celebration Institute

136 connections

Philip, Jake and 64 other mutual connections

Message
About

I began Life in the Oklahoma Seminole Nation. I have practiced organic gardening since childhood, organic farming for much of my adult Life, and regenerative horticulture, food forestry, and wildland restoration for the last decade. The studies and practices which inform my agroecology and ecorestoration thought and work (research, practice, and education) include western science soil biology/ecology; many realms of mycology, botany, ecology, and zoology; ecological anthropology and history; ethnobotany; herbalism; plant/fungi medicine work; “conventional” regenerative agriculture; ancient Indigenous agroecology and ecological land management sciences; landscape water retention; wetland restoration; syntropic agroforestry; food forestry; desert reforestation; Miyawaki reforestation; and ecology/climate physics (including Biotic Pump Theory). I integrate these western science studies, modern agroecology and ecorestoration practices, indigenous agroecology traditions and TEK, anthropogenic landscape studies, food/medicine work, and ecological history into a coherent picture of what human relationship with Earth looks like when we act as a steward species. My studies and practices focus on helping people meet their needs while restoring ecosystems and stabilizing global climate. I live in the Mimbres watershed near the Gila wilderness area, in the most northern range of the Chihuahua desert, in the unceded lands of the living Chiricahua peoples, of the Brown Bear, of the Jaguar, of the Beaver, and of the Forests and Wetlands which stood there 400 years ago.
… more
